segment.source: Add Language Interface Packs to Windows
segment.target: Add Language Interface Packs to Windows

segment.source: Add Language Interface Packs to Windows
segment.target: Add Language Interface Packs to Windows

segment.source: Add Language Interface Packs to Windows
segment.target: Add Language Interface Packs to Windows

segment.source: Language Interface Packs (LIPs) include Windows user interface text for a region.
segment.target: Language Interface Packs (LIPs) include Windows user interface text for a region.

segment.source: LIPs must be used with a valid parent language.
segment.target: LIPs must be used with a valid parent language.

segment.source: For example, the Catalan (ca-ES) LIP can be installed only if one of the following languages is already installed: English US (en-US), Great Britain (en-GB), Spanish (es-ES), or French (fr-FR).
segment.target: For example, the Catalan (ca-ES) LIP can be installed only if one of the following languages is already installed: English US (en-US), Great Britain (en-GB), Spanish (es-ES), or French (fr-FR).

segment.source: To add a LIP to an offline Windows image, you must verify that the supported parent language pack is installed to the Windows image first.
segment.target: To add a LIP to an offline Windows image, you must verify that the supported parent language pack is installed to the Windows image first.

segment.source: For a list of the LIPs and their parent languages, see Available Language Packs for Windows.
segment.target: For a list of the LIPs and their parent languages, see Available Language Packs for Windows.

segment.source: The version of the LIP must match the version of Windows.
segment.target: The version of the LIP must match the version of Windows.

segment.source: For example, you can't add a Windows 10 LIP to a Windows 8 image, or a Windows 8 LIP to a Windows 10 image.
segment.target: For example, you can't add a Windows 10 LIP to a Windows 8 image, or a Windows 8 LIP to a Windows 10 image.

segment.source: For Windows 10, language packs and LIPs are also available to download from Windows Update.
segment.target: For Windows 10, language packs and LIPs are also available to download from Windows Update.

segment.source: You can add additional languages by using Control Panel.
segment.target: You can add additional languages by using Control Panel.

segment.source: This process requires internet access and access to Windows Update.
segment.target: This process requires internet access and access to Windows Update.

segment.source: IT Professionals and end-users can use Windows Update to add additional languages to their Windows installations.
segment.target: IT Professionals and end-users can use Windows Update to add additional languages to their Windows installations.

segment.source: OEMs can view and download LIPs from the Microsoft OEM site.
segment.target: OEMs can view and download LIPs from the Microsoft OEM site.

segment.source: System Builders can view and download LIPs from the OEM Partner Center
segment.target: System Builders can view and download LIPs from the OEM Partner Center

segment.source: IT Professionals can view and download LIPs from the Local Language Program.
segment.target: IT Professionals can view and download LIPs from the Local Language Program.

segment.source: Users can get languages or LIPs from Windows Update.
segment.target: Users can get languages or LIPs from Windows Update.

segment.source: Go to SettingsTime & languageRegion & languageAdd a language.
segment.target: Go to SettingsTime & languageRegion & languageAdd a language.

segment.source: Select the language you want to use from the list, then choose which region's version you want to use.
segment.target: Select the language you want to use from the list, then choose which region's version you want to use.

segment.source: Your download will begin immediately.
segment.target: Your download will begin immediately.

segment.source: Install LIPs
segment.target: Install LIPs

segment.source: To install a LIP using audit mode (used for manufacturing PCs)
segment.target: To install a LIP using audit mode (used for manufacturing PCs)

segment.source: Download the appropriate LIP (and if necessary, its base language), and save it to removable media.
segment.target: Download the appropriate LIP (and if necessary, its base language), and save it to removable media.

segment.source: Boot the destination computer to audit mode.
segment.target: Boot the destination computer to audit mode.

segment.source: For example at the OOBE screen, press CTRL+SHIFT+F3.
segment.target: For example at the OOBE screen, press CTRL+SHIFT+F3.

segment.source: To learn more, see Boot Windows to Audit Mode or OOBE.
segment.target: To learn more, see Boot Windows to Audit Mode or OOBE.

segment.source: Insert the removable media and copy the LIP (and base language, if necessary) to the destination computer.
segment.target: Insert the removable media and copy the LIP (and base language, if necessary) to the destination computer.

segment.source: If the base language isn't already installed, install it: Navigate to the .cab file and double-click it.
segment.target: If the base language isn't already installed, install it: Navigate to the .cab file and double-click it.

segment.source: Follow the instructions to complete the installation.
segment.target: Follow the instructions to complete the installation.

segment.source: Install the LIP: Navigate to the .cab file and double-click it.
segment.target: Install the LIP: Navigate to the .cab file and double-click it.

segment.source: Follow the instructions to complete the installation.
segment.target: Follow the instructions to complete the installation.

segment.source: Exit audit mode and prepare the PC for image capture or deployment, for example:
segment.target: Exit audit mode and prepare the PC for image capture or deployment, for example:

segment.source: Open a command prompt and run:
segment.target: Open a command prompt and run:

segment.source: To learn more, see Sysprep (Generalize) a Windows installation.
segment.target: To learn more, see Sysprep (Generalize) a Windows installation.

segment.source: To install a LIP to an offline Windows image
segment.target: To install a LIP to an offline Windows image

segment.source: Download the appropriate LIP (and if necessary, its base language).
segment.target: Download the appropriate LIP (and if necessary, its base language).

segment.source: Open a command prompt with elevated permissions.
segment.target: Open a command prompt with elevated permissions.

segment.source: Mount the Windows image that you want to install the LIP to.
segment.target: Mount the Windows image that you want to install the LIP to.

segment.source: If the base LP isn't in the image already, add it.
segment.target: If the base LP isn't in the image already, add it.

segment.source: Add the LIP.
segment.target: Add the LIP.

segment.source: If you're creating Windows Setup media or using a distribution share, recreate the lang.ini file.
segment.target: If you're creating Windows Setup media or using a distribution share, recreate the lang.ini file.

segment.source: The lang.ini file in C:imagesWin10sources should look similar to the following:
segment.target: The lang.ini file in C:imagesWin10sources should look similar to the following:

segment.source: Optional: Change the default language, locale, and other international settings to the local language.
segment.target: Optional: Change the default language, locale, and other international settings to the local language.

segment.source: Optional: Review the default international settings.
segment.target: Optional: Review the default international settings.

segment.source: For example, you should see output similar to the following:
segment.target: For example, you should see output similar to the following:

segment.source: Unmount the image, committing the changes.
segment.target: Unmount the image, committing the changes.

segment.source: Your Windows image is ready to be deployed.
segment.target: Your Windows image is ready to be deployed.
